body: This is even more unfair than not separating them at all. I've seen scandals where entire teams of boys do this so they can win everything, and they don't even make them use any drugs or anything (not that it would take away a lot of their advantages anyway). The whole point of having separate boys and girls teams is because one usually has a huge physical advantage, not identity.

body: I get that but if we split it up that much everyone would be by themselves. However there is a much bigger division in athletics between men and women than most factors between men and men or women and women. I'm not exactly sure of the science but I believe it mostly boils down to body shape and all kinds of complex physics, and it's because males are optimized for physical labor and fighting so their athletic abilities reflect that.

post.title: It seems to me that there will be no women's competition soon

author.bio: I suffer from the heartbreak of re-revitiligo. A tragic congenital condition that causes my skin to be deficient in soul giving melanin, making me appear pale and lifeless, like a caucasian.
author.bio_html: I suffer from the heartbreak of re-revitiligo. A tragic congenital condition that causes my skin to be deficient in soul giving melanin, making me appear pale and lifeless, like a caucasian.

body:
My point is that there is nothing inherently "fair" about competition. If you declare a winner, you've declared iniquity.

The idea of sports categories isn't about "being fair," its about **creating confusion amongst spectators.** If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension. There's less incentive to watch or bet on the outcome. Its a bookie marketing gimmick that's been framed as a moral imperative.

The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise. The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks... Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard. Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.
body_html:
My point is that there is nothing inherently "fair" about competition. If you declare a winner, you've declared iniquity.

The idea of sports categories isn't about "being fair," its about creating confusion amongst spectators. If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension. There's less incentive to watch or bet on the outcome. Its a bookie marketing gimmick that's been framed as a moral imperative.

The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise. The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks... Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard. Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.

post.title: It seems to me that there will be no women's competition soon

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
> If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension.

Then what's even the point of having it? Every now and then there will be an unexpected win but otherwise that would be extremely boring for both the competitors and the audience.

> The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise.

Sports except at the professional level are nothing but recreation. There's little business to be found in most cases, all they can really do is sell snacks and t-shirts and tickets, which isn't much. Many don't even sell anything at all and have tiny audiences. I don't see how that's a "corrupt parasitic enterprise".

> The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks

So you think the *only* reason people do sports is to show off?

> Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard.

What does any of that have to do with sports.

> Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.

As if those are pure and honest and holy enterprises.
body_html:
If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension.

Then what's even the point of having it? Every now and then there will be an unexpected win but otherwise that would be extremely boring for both the competitors and the audience.

The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise.

Sports except at the professional level are nothing but recreation. There's little business to be found in most cases, all they can really do is sell snacks and t-shirts and tickets, which isn't much. Many don't even sell anything at all and have tiny audiences. I don't see how that's a "corrupt parasitic enterprise".

The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks

So you think the only reason people do sports is to show off?

Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard.

What does any of that have to do with sports.

Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.

As if those are pure and honest and holy enterprises.

parent.body:
My point is that there is nothing inherently "fair" about competition. If you declare a winner, you've declared iniquity.

The idea of sports categories isn't about "being fair," its about **creating confusion amongst spectators.** If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension. There's less incentive to watch or bet on the outcome. Its a bookie marketing gimmick that's been framed as a moral imperative.

The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise. The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks... Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard. Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.
parent.body_html:
My point is that there is nothing inherently "fair" about competition. If you declare a winner, you've declared iniquity.

The idea of sports categories isn't about "being fair," its about creating confusion amongst spectators. If the audience can easily tell who will win based on obvious physical advantages/abilities, then there's not nearly as much dramatic tension. There's less incentive to watch or bet on the outcome. Its a bookie marketing gimmick that's been framed as a moral imperative.

The whole sports industry has always been a corrupt parasitic enterprise. The idea that its an expression of achievement or excellence is bollocks... Its a proxy for church and national pride that used to be the American standard. Its an expensive and exploitative institution that only provides a distraction from politics and finances.

post.title: It seems to me that there will be no women's competition soon

body:
> Without women, wokeness would be rightly ridiculed out the door and hooted right up on the ash heap of bad history. Women want nothing more than a universal regime of fairness fascism. Women want a world where feeling are never hurt. Women want equality unequally enforced.

Really? Because this is more a description of SJWs, who in my experience are 90% rich white college-age males.

> We could have gone to the stars but we worried our women wouldn't allow us out the door so we stayed home with mommy eating junk food till it was much too late.

Yeah those types annoy me too but they aren't usually the ones who would seriously compete in stuff, at least not highly physical stuff like athletics.

Without women, wokeness would be rightly ridiculed out the door and hooted right up on the ash heap of bad history. Women want nothing more than a universal regime of fairness fascism. Women want a world where feeling are never hurt. Women want equality unequally enforced.

We could have gone to the stars but we worried our women wouldn't allow us out the door so we stayed home with mommy eating junk food till it was much too late.

Yeah those types annoy me too but they aren't usually the ones who would seriously compete in stuff, at least not highly physical stuff like athletics.

body:
When other cyclists criticised him for stealing their win, he demanded that they be banned for "transphobia". 

Deplatforming IRL, coming to town next to you. 

>Two of cyclist McKinnon’s competitors objected to the inclusion of a criticism-proof drag queen in what was supposed to be a women’s race. McKinnon’s response? He’s currently lobbying USAC, the national governing body for bicycle racing, to have those competitors ejected from the sport for their complaints!
body_html:
When other cyclists criticised him for stealing their win, he demanded that they be banned for "transphobia".

Deplatforming IRL, coming to town next to you.

Two of cyclist McKinnon’s competitors objected to the inclusion of a criticism-proof drag queen in what was supposed to be a women’s race. McKinnon’s response? He’s currently lobbying USAC, the national governing body for bicycle racing, to have those competitors ejected from the sport for their complaints!
